required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 12 Weeks Treatment With 3 Different Doses of BI 10773 in Type 2 Diabetic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase IIb, Randomized, Parallel Group Safety, Efficacy, and Pharmacokinetics Study of BI 10773 (5 mg, 10 mg and 25 mg) Administered Orally Once Daily Over 12 Weeks Compared Double Blind to Placebo, as Monotherapy, With an Additional Open-label Metformin Arm in Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Insufficient Glycemic Control

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to investigate the efficacy, safety and pharmacokinetics of three different doses of BI 10773 compared to placebo given for 12 weeks in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus with insufficient glycemic control. In addition an open-label metformin arm will be assessed

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Glycosilated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline After 12 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Change of HbA1c from baseline after 12 weeks of treatment. Note, adjusted means are presented. For the placebo and empa groups, measured values presented are for the model including only these treatment groups, for the metformin group the measured values presented are for the model including only placebo and metformin groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of FPG From Baseline After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change of Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) from baseline after 12 weeks of treatment. Results presented stem from a repeated measures analysis. Note, adjusted means are presented. For the placebo and empa groups, measured values presented are for the model including only these treatment groups, for the metformin group the measured values presented are for the model including only placebo and metformin groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of HbA1c From Baseline Over Time
secondary_outcome.description: Change of HbA1c from baseline over time. Results presented stem from a repeated measures analysis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Who Achieve an HbA1c ≤7.0% After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Results for HbA1c categories at week 12 (Proportion of patients with HbA1c less than equal to 7%).

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Patients Who Achieve an HbA1c Lowering of at Least 0.5% After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Results for HbA1c categories at week 12 (Proportion of patients with HbA1c lowered at least 0.5%).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 12 in Fasting Plasma Insulin (FPI)
secondary_outcome.description: Results for change of FPI from baseline at week 12 based on ANCOVA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Homeostasis Model Assessment Index for Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA-IR (to assess insulin resistance) is defined as (FPI x FPG)/22.5. Results based on ANCOVA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Homeostasis Model Assessment Index for Beta Cell Function (HOMA-%B)
secondary_outcome.description: HOMA-%B (to assess insulin beta cell function) is defined as (20 x FPI)/(FPG-3.5). Results are based on ANCOVA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Body Weight After 12 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Results for change of body weight after 12 weeks of treatment based on ANCOVA.

secondary_outcome.measure: Trough Concentrations of Empagliflozin in Plasma
secondary_outcome.description: Pre-dose (within 30 minutes before dosing) trough concentrations of Empagliflozin in plasma

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients with a diagnosis of type 2 diabetes mellitus
- either treatment-naïve or on a maximum of 1 oral antidiabetic therapy on a stable dose for the10 weeks prior to screening
- HbA1c ≥6.5 to ≤9.0% and for treatment-naïve patients:HbA1c >7.0 to ≤10.0%
- HbA1c >7.0 to ≤10.0% at Visit 2 (start of run-in) for all patients
- Age between 18 and 80 years
- BMI less than 40 kg/m2
- Signed and dated informed consent prior to admission to the study in accordance with GCP and local legislation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Myocardial infarction, stroke or TIA within 6 months prior to informed consent
2. Impaired hepatic function
3. Renal insufficiency or impaired renal function
4. Disease of central nervous system, or psychiatric disorders or clinically relevant neurologic disorders that may interfere with trial participation
5. Chronic or clinically relevant acute infections
6. Current or chronic urogenital tract infection determined by medical history
7. History of clinically relevant allergy/hypersensitivity
8. Treatment with glitazones, GLP-1 analogues or insulin within 3 months prior to informed consent
9. Treatment with anti obesity drugs
10. Current treatment with systemic steroids
11. Alcohol abuse
12. Treatment with an investigational drug within 2 months prior to informed consent
13. known intolerance to metformin
14. Dehydration
15. Unstable or acute CHF
16. Acute or chronic acidosis
17. Hereditary galactose intolerance
18. Woman of child bearing potential who are nursing or pregnant or not practicing an acceptable method of birth control

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients receive Placebo in tablets matching the Empagliflozin tablets in appearance once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 5 mg
group.description: Patients receive 5 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 10 mg
group.description: Patients receive 10 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 25 mg
group.description: Patients receive 25 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

group.title: Metformin OL
group.description: Patients were to take a open-label (OL) dose of 500 mg Metformin twice daily for the first 4 weeks. For the remaining 8 weeks, if the fasted blood glucose values were above 110 mg/dL (6.1 mmol/L), the dose was to be increased to 2 x 500 mg tablets twice daily or up to the maximum tolerated.

baseline.population: The treated set (TS) consisting of all randomised patients who were treated with at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients receive Placebo in tablets matching the Empagliflozin tablets in appearance once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 5 mg
group.description: Patients receive 5 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 10 mg
group.description: Patients receive 10 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 25 mg
group.description: Patients receive 25 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

group.title: Metformin OL
group.description: Patients were to take a dose of 500 mg Metformin (open-label) twice daily for the first 4 weeks. For the remaining 8 weeks, if the fasted blood glucose values were above 110 mg/dL (6.1 mmol/L), the dose was to be increased to 2 x 500 mg tablets twice daily or up to the maximum tolerated.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change of Glycosilated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline After 12 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Change of HbA1c from baseline after 12 weeks of treatment. Note, adjusted means are presented. For the placebo and empa groups, measured values presented are for the model including only these treatment groups, for the metformin group the measured values presented are for the model including only placebo and metformin groups.
outcome.population: The full analysis set (FAS) consists of all randomised patients who were treated with at least 1 dose of study drug and had a baseline measurement of the primary endpoint. Modified last observation carried forward was used as the imputation method (LOCF).

measure.title: Change of Glycosilated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline After 12 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Change of HbA1c from baseline after 12 weeks of treatment. Note, adjusted means are presented. For the placebo and empa groups, measured values presented are for the model including only these treatment groups, for the metformin group the measured values presented are for the model including only placebo and metformin groups.
measure.population: The full analysis set (FAS) consists of all randomised patients who were treated with at least 1 dose of study drug and had a baseline measurement of the primary endpoint. Modified last observation carried forward was used as the imputation method (LOCF).

analysis.p_value_desc: No formal testing so adjustment for multiple comparisons was not necessary.
analysis.method_desc: Based on ANCOVA with terms for baseline, treatment, number of previous anti-diabetic medications and country.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as empa 5mg minus placebo

analysis.p_value_desc: No formal testing so adjustment for multiple comparisons was not necessary.
analysis.method_desc: Based on ANCOVA with terms for baseline, treatment, number of previous anti-diabetic medications and country.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as empa 10mg minus placebo

analysis.p_value_desc: No formal testing so adjustment for multiple comparisons was not necessary.
analysis.method_desc: Based on ANCOVA with terms for baseline, treatment, number of previous anti-diabetic medications and country.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference calculated as empa 25mg minus placebo

reported_events.time_frame: From first drug administration until 7 days after last intake of study medication, up to 121 days

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Patients receive Placebo in tablets matching the Empagliflozin tablets in appearance once daily.

group.title: Empagliflozin 5 mg
group.description: Patients receive 5 mg Empagliflozin in tablets once daily.

For the remaining 8 weeks, if the fasted blood glucose values were above 110 mg/dL (6.1 mmol/L), the dose was to be increased to 2 x 500 mg tablets twice daily or up to the maximum tolerated.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Any publication of the result of this trial must be consistent with the Boehringer Ingelheim publication policy. The rights of the investigator and of the sponsor with regard to publication of the results of this trial are described in the investigator contract.
